pageContext.claim: “Michigan is one of the reasons I ran. I was honored in Michigan long before I thought about -- I was honored as the Man of the Year in Michigan at a big event.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump claims he's won Michigan’s “man of the year” award. But there's no evidence this is true. FactCheck.org investigated and it appears that Trump is referring to a 2013 dinner hosted by a county Republican Party organization, which presented him with token gifts – including a statuette of Abraham Lincoln. But a former Republican congressman who organized the dinner said Trump did not receive an award, and the group has never given out “man of the year” awards. As of August 2019, Trump had made this false claim seven times over three years.
